intro: Gerardia aphylla var. grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered gerardia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, along stream banks, and in other damp habitats. Gerardia aphylla var. grandiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
